current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To require the Federal Government to expedite the sale of
		  underutilized Federal real property.

committee-name.#text: Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Federal Real Property Asset Management
			 Reform Act of 2013
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Real Property Asset Management Reform Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

The purpose of this Act is to increase the
			 efficiency and effectiveness of the Federal Government in managing real
			 property by—

requiring agencies to maintain an
			 up-to-date inventory of real property;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
to develop guidance on and ensure the implementation of strategies for
			 better managing Federal real property; and

text.#text: establishing a

authorizing a pilot program to expedite the
			 disposal of surplus real property.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , is amended by adding at the end the following:
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
